# JavaProblem AbstractMethodWithImplementation

## A `@Generated(ABSTRACT)` method must not have an implementation

Methods annotated with `@Generated(ABSTRACT)` must not a 'real' implementation.
Only certain constructs that effectively throw an exception are allowed.

## Definition

### Code to Match

	@Generated(ABSTRACT)
	public AnyType anyMethod() {
		someBody
	}

### Validation

`someBody` contains any of

- `ExceptionUtils.subclassResponsibility()`
- `throw new SmtException("SMT error")`
- `throw new DoesNotUnderstandException()`

## Tests

### Smoketest

#### File sample.Foo.java

    package sample;
    
    @SuppressWarnings("all")
    public class Foo {
    
        @Generated(ABSTRACT)
        @Override
        public String foo() {
    
            return ExceptionUtils.subclassResponsibility();
        }
    
        @Generated(ABSTRACT)
        @Override
        public String bar() {
    
            return "";
        }
    
        @Generated({ABSTRACT, REPOSITORY_STUB, SUBSET_STUB})
        @Override
        public Color baz() {
            /* Abstract method created by ... */
    
            /* Subset stub generated by ... */
    
            throw new SmtException("SMT error");
        }
    
    
        @Generated({ABSTRACT, REPOSITORY_STUB, SUBSET_STUB})
        @Override
        public Color doo() {
            return null;
        }
    
        public String beez() {
            return ExceptionUtils.subclassResponsibility();
        }
    
        @Generated(ABSTRACT)
        public String booz() {
            throw new DoesNotUnderstandException();
        }
    
    }

#### Expected Output

    Foo.java\t13\tA `@Generated(ABSTRACT)` method must not have an implementation\tAbstractMethodWithImplementation
    Foo.java\t31\tA `@Generated(ABSTRACT)` method must not have an implementation\tAbstractMethodWithImplementation
